Like: Fun with friends.Dislike: dying/not hooking everyone.

If i was to describe this game in  3 words it be: fun, frustrating and addicting...There is a bit of grind due to the perk system, i.e collecting enough in game currency to progress your character to potentially unlock new perks. The perks allow for some interesting concepts and builds, i.e. sprinting faster, more map awareness, ability to heal yourself or other players while the perk system is great, the frustrating yet addicting bit is finding just how you're going to escape the killer. Believe me, this take practice. Escaping the killer requires reflexes, reflexes you'll learn very quickly. One wrong move within Dead by Daylight could be your fate to the killer. Playing with a friend or friend(s) is great as you're able to then communicate and strategise just how you're going to escape. The game is very strategic and your time whilst playing a survivor should either be rescueing a "hooked" survivor or repairing a generator. Ideally your teammates won't be hooked and this is were strategy comes into play.Overall I really like this game, It can be frustrating at first for a new player, however, If you over come the initial frustration and stick with it, you'll get better, obtain new perks, create weird builds with those  perks and hopefully make the killer go home and cry to mommy.I give this game 9.3 /10

I love being the killer and chasing the survivors. The thrill of the hunt and satisfaction of a capture are one of the many reasons I play.

I've played this game for more than 400 hours now and still very amusing and fun.I love how the developers being actively fixing bugs and error and pro-actively updating the game, unlike other survival game that you need to wait for a long time to experience the update.I am very pleased that the developers also do an overhaul to DBD, it removes the "getting tired part" of always seeing the same mechanics and settings of the gameplay.There are also a lot of skins for the characters so players will get tired of playing the old characters over and over again.I love the part of giving the chance for users to buy exclusive skins and characters/killers using in-game money(iridescent) , a very "connected to the heart of players thing" because some of us don't have enough money to spare to buy exclusive and expensive skins and other in-game items so that we can still enjoy the perks of the game which is very very very awesome!a Thousand KUDOS !!!!! to the team who maintain this game!

да
best game ever minus the bugs

This game is absurdly fun, that being said, this game is BUILT to be played with a team of people you know and can communicate with.  Obviously there are good players like in every game who can play alone and excel because that's just a talent / skill they've built up and even THEY will tell you this game is poorly made.THAT BEING SAID....this game has so many mechanics and issues that completely SOIL the fun experience of this game.  In just my few months and 83 ish hours of playing here's what I've noticed are the things that really just....kill this game for me, no pun intended.1 - killer hit radius is astronomical.  Their weapon may not even come in contact with your hitbox, and you will get hit...and i play on good ping.2- doing any action such as vaulting, entering lockers, or jumping over palettes has a weird start up frame thing as well as at the end, where even if you make it over you will still get hit most likely and you will only go INCREMENTALLY faster doing it.3 - looping is only useful if there are maps with good looping locations, otherwise you will not outrun the killer you simply just delay the inevitable.  Also the amount of times that i personally have been in an area where i can pull a palette but the game just doesn't give me the option, and the entity isn't blocking it is innumerable at this point.4 - these two things kind of go hand in hand so i will lump them into one point.  CAMPING AND TUNNELING.  These two unpunished tactics will be what murders this game in my opinion.  If a killer wants you dead you will die.  And don't even say anything about borrowed time because its actual success rate is based on luck the killer most likely will not walk more than eyeshot away from the hook you are dangling on (even though when you are taken off the hook the killer is notified).  And if the killer is across the map more than half the killer cast has an ability that will let them travel across the map at MACH speed, and if you are sprinting your scratch marks last 10 seconds, so you will be found again normally with relative quickness.  There is barely if any at all arguable GOOD punishment for these two abused "strategies" because in the time it takes one survivor to die, unless all other three survivors are going to gens at the same time you will most likely not even be able to finish a generator.  All this being said, because i am clearly biased to survivor roll. I HAVE PLAYED AS A KILLER and to top it off I played killers that couldn't turn invisible or fly across the map with dashes and stuff, and it was still CONSIDERABLY easier than doing any task as a survivor.  Some killers in fact can completely eradicate your ability to sense where they are.  As a killer it is so easy to tell when someone is just trying to goof you.  There is literally a notification for almost ever action a survivor makes WITHOUT THE USE OF PERKS and that's without mentioning the sometimes four different passives a killer's ability can have.  And i get it this is a 1v4 but at the end of the day the power balance is so incredibly leaning one way and there is such a slow output of fixes to these issues that the game is almost not enjoyable some days.I don't know I probably missed some stuff but again i will say THIS GAME IS VERY FUN but only based on the fact that this game is put together so poorly.  OH and there's only one game mode, and we were told we'd have a new side objective with the Blight update and I still have yet to see it.  So if you get this game, just know it is fun but you will also hate it more than probably every other game you've ever played eventually.

Dead by daylight is a fun asymetrical multiplayer game where 4 people are survivors, and one plays the killer. Due to the replayability of this game, it is well worth getting, better yet if you have friends you can play with.

Although the community tends to give a lot of hate towards this game it's actually one of the most addictive and funnest games on steam. It's by no means a perfect game. Yes, it has its flaws and the community is super toxic. However, it is hands down one of the best games Iv'e ever played.
